data.description: About Us: Live experiences help people cross today’s digital divide and focus on what truly connects us – the here, the now, this once-in-a-lifetime moment that’s bringing us together. To fulfill Gametime’s mission of uniting the world through shared experiences, we make it easy for people to discover and access the live experiences that matter most. With platforms on iOS, Android, mobile web and desktop supporting more than 60,000 events across the US and Canada, we are reimagining the event ticket industry in order to move at the speed of life.Job Summary: We’re looking for a motivated and curious Full Stack Engineering Intern to join our Conversational AI Search team this summer. This internship is an opportunity to work on the cutting edge of AI technology—contributing across the stack and pushing the boundaries of full-stack software engineering with workflow automation, AI integrations, and Agentic Solutions. You’ll work closely with senior engineers, ML specialists, and data scientists to build and scale intelligent features. By the end of the summer, the work you’ve done will be live in production—impacting real users and delivering measurable business value. Key Responsibilities: Develop full stack features using modern frontend frameworks and backend technologies to enhance Gametime's Conversational AI Search experience. Collaborate cross-functionally with Engineering, Data Science, and Product teams to define requirements and deliver high-impact features. Prototype and iterate on intelligent systems that leverage large language models (LLMs) for user-facing and internal tooling. Monitor and troubleshoot deployed services to ensure performance, reliability, and accuracy in real-world environments. Document technical decisions and share learnings with the broader engineering organization. Participate in Agile ceremonies including sprint planning, stand-ups, and retrospectives to support a fast-paced product cycle. Key Competencies: List the specific competencies (skills, behaviors, and abilities) required for success in this role, organized into key areas. Each competency should have a description that connects directly to the tasks in the job. Technical Skills: (Experience/Coursework) Frontend Development: Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, with exposure to frameworks like React. Backend Development: Exposure to developing RESTful APIs and backend services using languages such as Golang, Node.js, or Python. Database Knowledge: Understanding of NoSQL databases (Mongo, OpenSearch) for storing and retrieving application data. Dev Tools Exposure: Comfort with using GIT, IDEs, AWS, Docker, command line tools, and debugging utilities to support development workflows. Interpersonal Skills: Team Collaboration: Ability to effectively work with engineers, product managers, and designers to deliver project goals. Clear Communication: Comfortable explaining technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences; receptive to feedback and team input. Problem-Solving and Decision-Making: Analytical Thinking: Demonstrates strong critical thinking when debugging issues or designing new features. Proactive Problem Solving: Identifies potential obstacles early and communicates proactively with mentors or peers to resolve them. Minimum Qualifications: Define the minimum educational and experiential requirements necessary to apply for the role. Education: Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Engineering, or a related field. Experience: None required. Certifications: None required but could be a plus. Performance Metrics: Outline specific measures of success in the role. These should be aligned with the key competencies and job responsibilities. Completion of Core Projects: Deliver and present at least one fully scoped feature or product improvement in production by the end of the internship. Technical Growth: Demonstrate increased autonomy and understanding through weekly 1:1 check-ins and consistent skill progression.At Gametime pay ranges are subject to change and assigned to a job based on specific market median of similar jobs according to 3rd party salary benchmark surveys. Individual pay within that range can vary for several reasons including skills/capabilities, experience, and available budget.United States - Pay Range$26 - $31 USDGametime is committed to bringing together individuals from different backgrounds and perspectives. We strive to create an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do great work together. As an equal opportunity employer, we prohibit any unlawful discrimination against a job applicant on the basis of their race, color, religion, veteran status, sex, parental status, gender identity or expression, transgender status, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability or genetic information. We respect the laws enforced by the EEOC and are dedicated to going above and beyond in fostering diversity across our company.
requirements: Develop full stack features using modern frontend frameworks and backend technologies to enhance Gametime's Conversational AI Search experience.
Database Knowledge: Understanding of NoSQL databases (Mongo, OpenSearch) for storing and retrieving application data.
Education: Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Engineering, or a related field.
